<html><body><div><div class="article-body | article w-100"><p class="text | article-text">MEDINA COUNTY, Ohio (WOIO) - One of two Northeast Ohio law enforcement officers indicted for unlawfully detaining a man they thought was in the country illegally, pleaded guilty in Medina County Court of Common Pleas Monday.</p><p class="text | article-text">Portage County Deputy Daniel LaJack pleaded guilty to the reduced charge of attempted abduction.</p><p class="text | article-text">LaJack will be sentenced on March 26.</p><p class="text | article-text">His co-defendant is Cleveland Police Detective Donald Kopchak.</p><p class="w-100"></p><p class="text | article-text">Kopchak is charged with two counts of abduction, ethnic intimidation, and assault. </p><p class="text | article-text">His trial was scheduled to begin Monday, but it was continued and there is no new court date.</p><p class="text | article-text">Kopchak was also on the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF) task force at the time.</p><p class="text | article-text"><a unlawfully detaining man at bar they call ‘illegal’</b></a></p><p class="w-100"></p><p class="text | article-text">The charges stem from an incident that happened around 11:50 p.m. on April 26, 2024
